summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP on February 5, 2019. It commands the firm to produce all non-privileged documents related to the civil litigation involving Ghislaine Maxwell (M. Maxwell, 15 Civ. 7433 (RWS)) by February 15, 2019, as part of a federal criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking. The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: M. Maxwell
persons.context: The subpoena defines 'the Litigation' as the civil case captioned 'M. Maxwell, 15 Civ. 7433 (RWS)' in the Southern District of New York, indicating she is the central subject of the documents being sought.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena to obtain documents from a law firm related to the civil litigation involving Maxwell, as part of a federal criminal investigation.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, demanding production of documents related to the Ghislaine Maxwell civil litigation.

events.title: Subpoena Return Date
events.description: The deadline for Boies Schiller Flexner LLP to produce the requested documents to the grand jury, unless they produce records electronically by this date to avoid a personal appearance.

locations: Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, 575 Lexington Avenue, New York, NY 10022
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official federal grand jury investigation into suspected felony violations, specifically citing statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement).
The government explicitly requests the law firm not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The subpoena demands all non-privileged documents related to the civil litigation 'M. Maxwell, 15 Civ. 7433 (RWS),' directly linking the criminal investigation to Ghislaine Maxwell.
The requested materials include discovery materials, interview/deposition records, court filings, evidence, and settlement agreements from the Maxwell civil case.
The document shows the U.S. Attorney's Office was actively using grand jury powers to gather evidence from a law firm in early 2019, during the investigation that later led to Maxwell's arrest.
